description: This table contains all coding mutations in genes listed in the Cancer Gene Census.

fields.name: Gene_name
fields.description: The gene name for which the data has been curated in COSMIC. In most cases this is the accepted HGNC symbol.

fields.name: Accession_Number
fields.description: The transcript identifier of the gene.

fields.name: Gene_CDS_length
fields.description: Length of the gene (base pair) counts.

fields.name: HGNC_ID
fields.description: Unique HGNC identifier, if the gene is in HGNC.

fields.name: Sample_name
fields.description: A sample is an instance of a portion of a tumour being examined for mutations. The sample name can be derived from a number of sources. In many cases it originates from the cell line name. Other sources include names assigned by the annotators, or an incremented number assigned during an anonymisation process. A number of samples can be taken from a single tumour and a number of tumours can be obtained from one individual. A sample id is used to identify a sample within the COSMIC database. There can be multiple ids, if the same sample has been entered into the database multiple times from different papers.

fields.name: ID_sample
fields.description: (see description for Sample_name field)

fields.name: ID_tumour
fields.description: (see description for Sample_name field)

fields.name: Primary_site
fields.description: The primary tissue/cancer from which the sample originated. More details on the tissue classification are avaliable from http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/classification. In COSMIC we have standard classification system for tissue types and sub types because they vary a lot between different papers.

fields.name: Site_subtype_1
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 1) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Site_subtype_2
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 2) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Site_subtype_3
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 3) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Primary_histology
fields.description: The histological classification of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_1
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 1) of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_2
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 2) of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_3
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 3) of the sample.

fields.name: Genome_wide_screen
fields.description: if the entire genome/exome is sequenced

fields.name: GENOMIC_MUTATION_ID
fields.description: Unique mutation identifier

fields.name: LEGACY_MUTATION_ID
fields.description: Unique mutation identifier

fields.name: MUTATION_ID
fields.description: Unique mutation identifier

fields.name: Mutation_CDS
fields.description: The change that has occurred in the nucleotide sequence. Formatting is identical to the method used for the peptide sequence.

fields.name: Mutation_AA
fields.description: The change that has occurred in the peptide sequence. Formatting is based on the recommendations made by the Human Genome Variation Society. The description of each type can be found by following the link to Mutation Overview page.

fields.name: Mutation_Description
fields.description: Type of mutation (substitution, deletion, insertion, complex, fusion, unknown etc.)

fields.name: Mutation_zygosity
fields.description: Information on whether the mutation was reported to be homozygous , heterozygous or unknown within the sample.

fields.name: LOH
fields.description: LOH Information on whether the gene was reported to have loss of heterozygosity in the sample: yes, no or unknown.

fields.name: GRCh
fields.description: The coordinate system used.

fields.name: Mutation_genome_position
fields.description: The genomic cooridnates of the mutation.

fields.name: Mutation_strand
fields.description: Positive or negative.

fields.name: SNP
fields.description: All the known SNPs are flagged as 'y' defined by the 1000 genomes project, dbSNP and a panel of 378 normal (non-cancer) samples from Sanger CGP sequencing.

fields.name: Resistance_Mutation
fields.description: The mutation confers drug resistance (see CosmicResistanceMutations.tsv.gz for gene/drug details).

fields.name: FATHMM_prediction
fields.description: More information about FATHMM (Functional Analysis through Hidden Markov Models) is available from http://fathmm.biocompute.org.uk. FATHMM  descriptors: Pathogenic = Defined as Cancer or Damaging; Neutral = Defined as Passenger or Tolerated.

fields.name: FATHMM_score
fields.description: The scores are in the form of pvalues ranging from 0 to 1. Pvalues greater than 0.5 are pathogenic while  less than 0.5 are benign. Pvalues close to 0 or 1 are the high confidence results which are more accurate. The results are annotated as 10 feature groups (separately for coding and non coding variants) details of which can be found in the original FATHMM-MKL paper.

fields.name: Mutation_somatic_status
fields.description: Information on whether the sample was reported to be Confirmed Somatic, Previously Reported or Variant of unknown origin.

fields.name: Pubmed_PMID
fields.description: The PUBMED ID for the paper that the sample was noted in, linking to pubmed to provide more details of the publication.

fields.name: ID_STUDY
fields.description: Lists the unique Ids of studies that have involved this sample.

fields.name: Sample_Type
fields.description: Describes where the sample has originated from including the tumour type.

fields.name: Tumour_origin
fields.description: (see description for Sample_Type field)

fields.name: Age
fields.description: Age of the individual (if this information is provided with the publications).

fields.name: Tier
fields.description: Classification Tier (1 or 2): Tier 2 of the Cancer Gene Census consists of genes with strong indications of roles in cancer but with less expansive available evidence, compared to Tier 1.

fields.name: HGVSP
fields.description: Human Genome Variation Society peptide syntax.

fields.name: HGVSC
fields.description: Human Genome Variation Society coding dna sequence syntax (CDS).

fields.name: HGVSG
fields.description: Human Genome Variation Society genomic syntax (3' shifted).
